summary: This is a motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team seeking to exclude any evidence the government intends to offer under Federal Rule of Evidence 404(b) due to alleged failure to comply with the rule's notice requirements. The motion argues the government's October 11, 2021 notice letter was insufficient and requests exclusion or additional time to respond.

events.title: Government's Rule 404(b) Notice Deadline
events.description: Deadline set by the court for the government to provide notice of any Rule 404(b) evidence it intends to offer at trial.

events.title: Filing of Motion to Exclude Evidence
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team files this motion to exclude Rule 404(b) evidence due to insufficient notice.

events.title: Amendments to Rule 404(b)
events.description: Federal Rule of Evidence 404(b) was amended to impose additional notice requirements in criminal cases.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The government served a 'Maxwell Rule 404(b) letter' on October 11, 2021, referencing emails between Maxwell and 'influential' men about setting up dates and a witness who worked for Epstein from 2005-2006.
The defense argues the government's notice failed to identify specific evidence, articulate non-propensity purposes, or provide reasoning as required by the amended Rule 404(b).
The motion reveals the government provided approximately 400 pages of materials related to a newly disclosed witness on October 12, 2021.

The defense claims the government's notice references evidence from after the charged conspiracy period (which allegedly ended in 2004), including flight logs from 2005-2013 and financial statements from 2007.
Maxwell's attorneys request exclusion of the evidence or, alternatively, additional time to investigate and respond to the government's notice.
